get.summary: Get all tables for an app

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The application identifier.

post.summary: Create a new table in an app

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the app where the table will be created.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The table identifier (dbid).

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the app containing the table.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The table identifier (dbid).

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the app containing the table.

parameters.description: The table identifier (dbid).

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the child table.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of relationships to skip.

post.description: Creates a relationship in a table as well as lookup/summary fields. Relationships can only be created for tables within the same app.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table. This will be the child table.

summaryFields.description: Array of summary field objects which will turn into summary fields in the parent table. When you specify the 'COUNT' accumulation type, you have to specify 0 as the summaryFid (or not set it in the request). 'DISTINCT-COUNT' requires that summaryFid be set to an actual fid.

label.description: The label for the summary field.

accumulationType.description: The accumulation type for the summary field.

where.description: The filter, using the Quickbase query language, which determines the records to return.

lookupFieldIds.description: Array of field ids in the parent table that will become lookup fields in the child table.

parentTableId.description: The parent table id for the relationship.

foreignKeyField.description: This property is optional.  If it is not provided, the foreign key field will be created with the label ‘Related <record>’, where <record> is the name of a record in the parent table.

label.description: The label for the foreign key field.

id.description: The relationship id (foreign key field id).

parentTableId.description: The parent table id of the relationship.

childTableId.description: The child table id of the relationship.

isCrossApp.description: Whether this is a cross-app relationship.

post.description: Use this endpoint to add lookup fields and summary fields to an existing relationship. Updating a relationship will not delete existing lookup/summary fields.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table. This will be the child table.

parameters.name: relationshipId
parameters.description: The relationship id. This is the field id of the reference field on the child table.

summaryFields.description: An array of objects, each representing a configuration of one field from the child table, that will become summary fields on the parent table. When you specify the 'COUNT' accumulation type, you have to specify 0 as the summaryFid (or not set it in the request). 'DISTINCT-COUNT' requires that summaryFid be set to an actual fid.

label.description: The label for the summary field.

accumulationType.description: The accumulation type for the summary field.

where.description: The filter, using the Quickbase query language, which determines the records to return.

lookupFieldIds.description: An array of field ids on the parent table that will become lookup fields on the child table.

id.description: The relationship id (foreign key field id).

parentTableId.description: The parent table id of the relationship.

childTableId.description: The child table id of the relationship.

isCrossApp.description: Whether this is a cross-app relationship.

delete.description: Use this endpoint to delete an entire relationship, including all lookup and summary fields. The reference field in the relationship will not be deleted.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table. This will be the child table.

parameters.name: relationshipId
parameters.description: The relationship id. This is the field id of the reference field on the child table.

get.description: Get the schema (properties) of all reports for a table. If the user running the API is an application administrator, the API will also return all personal reports with owner's user id.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the table.

schema.description: This is simple example of report schema for more details please refer [Report types page](../reportTypes)

id.description: The identifier of the report, unique to the table.

name.description: The configured name of the report.

type.description: The type of report in Quickbase (e.g., chart).

description.description: The configured description of a report.

ownerId.description: Optional, showed only for personal reports. The user ID of report owner.

query.description: The query definition as configured in Quickbase that gets executed when the report is run.

tableId.description: The table identifier for the report.

filter.description: Filter used to query for data.

decimalPrecision.description: For numeric formula the number precision.

properties.description: A list of properties specific to the report type. To see a detailed description of the properties for each report type, See [Report Types.](../reportTypes)

usedLast.description: The instant at which a report was last used.

usedCount.description: The number of times a report has been used.

get.summary: Get usage statistics for a single field
get.description: Retrieve usage statistics for a specific field, summarizing where it is referenced across QuickBase features such as reports, forms, and pipelines.

parameters.name: fieldId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (fid) of the field.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table containing the field.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: Identifies the client making the request. Can be custom or default from your toolkit.

post.description: Allows running a formula via an API call. Use this method in custom code to get the value back of a formula without a discrete field on a record.

schema.description: The following example will execute a Sum() for '20' and the value in a record with id 1 for the field with label 'NumericField'. Since this API is able to run any type of formula, all results will be returned as a string.

formula.description: The formula to run. This must be a valid Quickbase formula.

rid.description: The record ID to run the formula against. Only necessary for formulas that are run in the context of a record. For example, the formula User() does not need a record ID.

from.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table.

207.description: Multi-Status - partial success with some errors

get.summary: Get a temporary authorization token for a specific dbid

parameters.name: dbid
parameters.description: The database identifier (dbid).

post.description: Use this endpoint to exchange a SAML assertion for a Quickbase token following [RFC 8693](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8693.html). Callers can choose to return a token compatible with SCIM, XML, or RESTful APIs. The token duration is determined by the [SAML timeout session time](https://helpv2.quickbase.com/hc/en-us/articles/4570410646420-SAML-assertion-example#:~:text=Setting%20SAML%20timeout%20session%20time). You must be able to create a SAML assertion in your code to use this endpoint. The SAML assertion is verified against the configuration on the realm. Learn more about about [SAML assertions](https://helpv2.quickbase.com/hc/en-us/articles/4570410646420-SAML-assertion-example).

grant_type.description: The value `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange` indicates that a token exchange is being performed.

requested_token_type.description: An identifier for the type of the requested security token. For the RESTful API, use `urn:quickbase:params:oauth:token-type:temp_token`. For the XML or SCIM APIs use `urn:quickbase:params:oauth:token-type:temp_ticket`.

subject_token.description: A security token that represents the identity of the party on behalf of whom the request is being made. For SAML 2.0, the value should be a base64url-encoded SAML 2.0 assertion.

subject_token_type.description: An identifier that indicates the type of the security token in the `subject_token` parameter.

access_token.description: The security token issued by the authorization server in response to the token exchange request. The identifier `access_token` is used for historical reasons and the issued token need not be an OAuth access token.

issued_token_type.description: An identifier for the representation of the issued security token.

post.description: Clones the authenticated user token. All applications associated with that token are automatically associated with the new token.

name.description: The new name for the cloned user token.

description.description: The description for the cloned user token.

active.description: Whether the user token is active.

apps.description: The list of apps this user token is assigned to.

id.description: The unique identifier for this application.

lastUsed.description: The last date this user token was used, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

post.description: Transfers the specified user token. Application associations will remain intact. For security, permissions must manually be reconciled.

id.description: The id of the user token to transfer

from.description: The id of the user to transfer the user token from

to.description: The id of the user to transfer the user token to

active.description: Whether the user token is active.

apps.description: The list of apps this user token is assigned to.

id.description: The unique identifier for this application.

lastUsed.description: The last date this user token was used, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

post.description: Deactivates the authenticated user token. Once this is done, the user token must be reactivated in the user interface.

delete.description: Deletes the authenticated user token. This is not reversible.

get.description: Downloads the file attachment, with the file attachment content encoded in base64 format. The API response returns the file name in the `Content-Disposition` header. Meta-data about files can be retrieved from the /records and /reports endpoints, where applicable. Use those endpoints to get the necessary information to fetch files.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the table.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the record.

parameters.name: fieldId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the field.

parameters.name: versionNumber
parameters.description: The file attachment version number.

delete.description: Deletes one file attachment version. Meta-data about files can be retrieved from the /records and /reports endpoints, where applicable. Use those endpoints to get the necessary information to delete file versions.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the table.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the record.

parameters.name: fieldId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the field.

parameters.name: versionNumber
parameters.description: The file attachment version number.

fileName.description: The name of file associated with deleted version.

uploaded.description: The timestamp when the version was originally uploaded.

userName.description: User Name as updated in user properties. Optional, appears if not the same as user email.

post.description: Get all users in an account or narrowed down list of users filtered by email(s). The returned users may be paginated depending on the user count. The count of the returned users may vary. When `nextPageToken` value in the response is not empty, that indicates that there are more results to be returned, you can use this value to get the next result set ('page').

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The account id being used to get users. If no value is specified, the first account associated with the requesting user token is chosen.

emails.description: When provided, the returned users will be narrowed down only to the users included in this list.

appIds.description: When provided, the returned users will be narrowed down only to the users assigned to the app id's provided in this list. The provided app id's should belong to the same account.

nextPageToken.description: Next page token used to get the next 'page' of results when available. When this field is empty, the first page is returned.

users.description: A list of users found in an account with the given criterias

put.description: Denies users access to the realm but leaves them listed in groups they have been added to.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The account id being used to deny users. If no value is specified, the first account associated with the requesting user token is chosen.

schema.description: A list of user IDs that need to be denied.

failure.description: A list of users that couldn't be denied. This also includes the ID's of users that are not valid.

success.description: A list of users that have successfully been denied.

put.description: Denies users access to the realm and allows you to remove them from groups.
put.summary: Deny and remove users from groups

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The account id being used to deny users. If no value is specified, the first account associated with the requesting user token is chosen.

parameters.name: shouldDeleteFromGroups
parameters.description: Specifies if the users should also be removed from all groups.

schema.description: A list of user IDs that need to be denied.

failure.description: A list of users that couldn't be denied. This also includes the ID's of users that are not valid.

success.description: A list of users that have successfully been denied.

put.description: Grants users that have previously been denied access to the realm.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The account id being used to undeny users. If no value is specified, the first account associated with the requesting user token is chosen.

schema.description: A list of user IDs that need to be undenied.

failure.description: A list of users that couldn't be undenied. This also includes the ID's of users that are not valid.

success.description: A list of users that have successfully been undenied.

post.description: Adds a list of users to a given group as members.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the group being modified.

schema.description: A list of user IDs that will be added to a group.

items.description: The Id and its hash value of the user to be added to a group.

failure.description: A list of users that couldn’t be added to the group. This includes a list of IDs that represent invalid users and users who have already been added to the group.

success.description: A list of users that have been added to the group successfully.

delete.description: Removes a list of members from a given group.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the group being modified.

schema.description: A list of user IDs that will be removed from a group.

items.description: The Id and its hash value of the user to be removed from a group.

failure.description: A list of users that couldn’t be removed from the group. This includes a list of IDs that represent invalid users.

success.description: A list of users that have been removed from the group successfully.

post.description: Adds a list of users to a given group as managers.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the group being modified.

schema.description: A list of user IDs that will be added to a group.

items.description: The Id and its hash value of the user to be added to a group.

failure.description: A list of users that couldn’t be added to the group. This includes a list of IDs that represent invalid users and users who have already been added to the group.

success.description: A list of users that have been added to the group successfully.

delete.description: Removes a list of managers from a given group.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the group being modified.

schema.description: A list of user IDs that will be removed from a group.

items.description: The Id and its hash value of the user to be removed from a group.

failure.description: A list of users that couldn’t be removed from the group. This includes a list of IDs that represent invalid users.

success.description: A list of users that have been removed from the group successfully.

post.description: Adds a list of groups to a given group.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the group being modified.

schema.description: A list of group IDs that will be added to a group.

items.description: The Id and its hash value of the child group to be added to a group.

failure.description: A list of child groups that couldn’t be added to the group. This includes a list of IDs that represent invalid groups and groups that have already been added to the group.

success.description: A list of child groups that have been added to the group successfully.

delete.description: Removes a list of groups from a given group.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the group being modified.

schema.description: A list of group IDs that will be removed from a group.

items.description: The Id and its hash value of the child group to be removed from a group.

failure.description: A list of child groups that couldn’t be removed from the group. This includes a list of IDs that represent invalid groups.

success.description: A list of child groups that have been removed from the group successfully.

post.description:
Gathers the audit logs for a single day from a realm. By default, this API returns 10,000 entries. This can be changed with the numRows parameter. Integrators can iterate through batches to get an entire day's worth of logs. Each realm has a maximum entitlement of querying 1,000 days per year (allowing lookbacks for up to two years). Requests for paginated data do not count towards the annual limit. Transactional rate limits are 10 per 10 seconds.  
**Note:** This API is available for enterprise users only.

nextToken.description: Token specifying start of page. For first page don't supply this.

numRows.description: Number of logs to return per page, default is 10000, minimum is 1000, max is 50000.

queryId.description: The query id of an audit log request. This id is needed to fetch subsequent paged results of a single query.

date.description: The date for which audit logs need to be fetched. This must be date-time only, as YYYY-MM-DD, and a valid date in the past.

topics.description: An array that may contain up to 20 [topics](https://resources.quickbase.com/nav/app/budurkasx/action/showpage/2b2941e4-f34d-4d41-9b0e-db790d20e9ab?pageIdV2=quickbase.com-DashboardGroup-15760d74-2243-4ce9-9495-7cc8790f12e7) to filter by. If empty, all topics are returned.

200.description: Query ran successfully and has returned the events for the given time period.

events.useragent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_15_4) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/13.1 Safari/605.1.15
events.description: Jon Doe accessed the app dashboard in app Projects

queryId.description: Query id of the requested audit log.

events.description: All events of the audit log.

topic.description: What action was taken, such as log in, create app, report access, or table search.

time.description: Exact time the action was taken, including date, and time with hour, minutes and seconds. Time zone is the browser time zone.

ipaddress.description: The IP address the action was taken from.

useragent.description: The browser and OS the action was taken from.

application.description: UI for user interface or API for an API call.

description.description: A brief description of the action that you can click to see additional details.

payloadChanges.description: The data changes that have occured to a field that has been marked as audited.

changes.description: An object describing the changes that occured on record changes.

current.description: The current value of the fields that have been changed.

previous.description: The previous value of the fields that have been changed.

fields.description: The list of fields and their types that have been changed.

rid.description: The recordId that has been edited.

changeType.description: The change type that occured for a record. Could be one of add, edit, delete.

nextToken.description: Token to fetch the next 1000 logs.

202.description: Query still being processed. Pass the queryId back to the API to check for results.

queryId.description: Query id of the requested audit log.

get.description:
Get user read and integration read summaries for any day in the past.  
**Note:** This API is available for enterprise users only.

parameters.name: day
parameters.description: The date for which read summaries need to be fetched. This must be date-time only, as YYYY-MM-DD, and a valid date in the past.

date.description: The date of the requested summary.

reads.description: Total reads for the specified date.

user.description: Total user reads for the realm on the specified date.

integrations.description: Total integration reads for the realm on the specified date.

eoti.description: Total reads by anonymous users for the realm on the specified date.

api.description: Total API reads for the realm on the specified date.

pipelines.description: Total pipeline reads for the realm on the specified date.

parameters.description: The ID of the account to query. If no value is specified, the first account matching the provided domain is chosen.
parameters.name: accountId

start.description: The start date and time of the requested summaries in ISO 8601 time format.

end.description: The end date and time of the requested summaries in ISO 8601 time format.

groupBy.description: How the events should be grouped.

nextToken.description: A pagination token from a previous response. Used to fetch the next page.

where.description: A list of items to filter events by. Only events which match ALL criteria will be included in the results.

id.description: Id of the item to filter by - the hash uid if filtering a user, or the app id if filtering an app.

type.description: The type of item to filter by.

accountId.description: The ID of the account the events are associated with.

start.description: The start date and time of the requested summaries in ISO 8601 time format.

end.description: The end date and time of the requested summaries in ISO 8601 time format.

groupBy.description: How the events should be grouped.

id.description: Id of the item to filter by.

type.description: The type of item to filter by.

results.description: An array of objects that contains Application/User information and an events object with summaries by event type.

eventTypes.description: An array of events that contains specific information associated with an Application/User broken down by event type.

billingCategory.description: Billing category of the event type.

count.description: Count of events associated with that event type and Application/User.

totals.description: Totals by billing category for the event grouping.

metadata.description: Additional information about the results that may be helpful.

nextToken.description: Supply this token in a subsequent request to fetch the next page of results.

totals.description: Totals by billing category for all queried events.

post.description:
Get event summaries for any span of days up to one year and excluding future dates.  
**Note:** This API is available for enterprise users only. Data is updated hourly; to ensure accuracy, query dates should be at least one hour in the past. Transactional rate limits are 100 per hour.

get.description:
Returns the QBL for the specified solution. Learn more about [QBL syntax](https://help.quickbase.com/hc/en-us/articles/24845511223828-What-is-QBL).  
 We are releasing schema coverage for QBL in stages. See [what's supported today](https://helpv2.quickbase.com/hc/en-us/articles/30119680754068-QBL-version-0-4-overview) in our QBL documentation.

parameters.name: solutionId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of a solution

parameters.name: qBLVersion
parameters.description: The QBL version to be used for the export. If not specified the default would be used.

schema.example:
Solution:
  Id: 8d2c3333-7d32-4ece-8073-57106c465384
  Name: Example solution
  Owner: manager@yourrealm.com
  ExportDate: 2024-03-25 12:04:05
Version: 0.2
Resources:
  $App_Example_app:
    Type: QB::Application
    Properties:
      Name: Example app
      Description: 
      AppColor: '#72509a'
      Manager: manager@yourrealm.com
      TableOrder: []
      AppIcon: Application
      CurrencySymbol: $
      FiscalYearDesignation: Last
      FirstDayOfWeek: Sun
      DateFormat: MM-DD-YYYY
      FirstMonthOfFiscalYear: Jan
      CurrencySymbolPosition: Between
      NumberFormat:
        SeparatorStyle: CommaGroupingPeriodDecimal
        SeparatorPlaces: none
      DefaultViewMode: Auto
      HideNewUpdatedIcons: false
      DisableAllUsersSelection: false
      CanCopyApp: Admin
      CanExportData: Everyone
      Searchable: false
      RequireAppToken: true
      ShowPerformanceBar: false
      ShowPerformanceAnalyzer: false
      GlobalSearchExactMatch: false
      Utf8DataEncoding: false
      Timezone: Default
      Branding:
        AppHeader:
          HideQuickbaseStandardMenu: false
        AppFooter: {}
      RoleOrder:
        - !Ref
          Role: $Role_Viewer
        - !Ref
          Role: $Role_Participant
        - !Ref
          Role: $Role_Administrator
    Roles:
      $Role_Viewer:
        Type: QB::Application::Role
        Properties:
          Name: Viewer
          Description: 
          Default: false
          ManageUsers: false
          EditApp: false
          DisableAccess: false
          AppUI:
            HideSettings: false
            HideUsers: false
            HideFavorites: false
            HideSearch: false
            HideHelp: false
            HideTestAs: false
          TableUI:
            Global:
              HideInBar: false
              HideNewRecord: false
              HideGridEdit: false
              HideEmail: false
              HidePrint: false
              HideImportExport: false
              HideSaveSpreadsheet: false
              HideCreateCustomizeReport: false
              HidePersonalSettings: false
      $Role_Participant:
        Type: QB::Application::Role
        Properties:
          Name: Participant
          Description: 
          Default: true
          ManageUsers: true
          EditApp: false
          DisableAccess: false
          AppUI:
            HideSettings: false
            HideUsers: false
            HideFavorites: false
            HideSearch: false
            HideHelp: false
            HideTestAs: false
          TableUI:
            Global:
              HideInBar: false
              HideNewRecord: false
              HideGridEdit: false
              HideEmail: false
              HidePrint: false
              HideImportExport: false
              HideSaveSpreadsheet: false
              HideCreateCustomizeReport: false
              HidePersonalSettings: false
      $Role_Administrator:
        Type: QB::Application::Role
        Properties:
          Name: Administrator
          Description: 
          Default: false
          ManageUsers: true
          EditApp: true
          DisableAccess: false
          AppUI:
            HideSettings: false
            HideUsers: false
            HideFavorites: false
            HideSearch: false
            HideHelp: false
            HideTestAs: false
          TableUI:
            Global:
              HideInBar: false
              HideNewRecord: false
              HideGridEdit: false
              HideEmail: false
              HidePrint: false
              HideImportExport: false
              HideSaveSpreadsheet: false
              HideCreateCustomizeReport: false
              HidePersonalSettings: false

400.description: Bad request. For example: Missing required headers, Missing required parameters, Malformed QBL and others. Message should provide more information, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

404.description: Solution does not exist. The supplied solution ID was not found.

401/403.description: Insufficient access. This could be for many reasons such as: User doesn’t have SolutionHub access, User is not the owner or a contributor for the solution, User cannot create apps and others.  Message should provide more information.

4xx/5xx.description: Non-common error, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

put.description:
Updates the solution using the provided QBL. Learn more about [QBL syntax](https://help.quickbase.com/hc/en-us/articles/24845511223828-What-is-QBL).  
 We are releasing schema coverage for QBL in stages. See [what's supported today](https://helpv2.quickbase.com/hc/en-us/articles/30119680754068-QBL-version-0-4-overview) in our QBL documentation.

parameters.name: solutionId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of a solution

parameters.name: generated
parameters.description: The QBL to be used for the update.

schema.example:
Version: 0.2
Resources:
  $App_Example_app:
    Type: QB::Application
    Properties:
      Name: Example app
      Description: 
      AppColor: '#72509a'
      Manager: manager@yourrealm.com
      TableOrder: []
      AppIcon: Application
      CurrencySymbol: $
      FiscalYearDesignation: Last
      FirstDayOfWeek: Sun
      DateFormat: MM-DD-YYYY
      FirstMonthOfFiscalYear: Jan
      CurrencySymbolPosition: Between
      NumberFormat:
        SeparatorStyle: CommaGroupingPeriodDecimal
        SeparatorPlaces: none
      DefaultViewMode: Auto
      HideNewUpdatedIcons: false
      DisableAllUsersSelection: false
      CanCopyApp: Admin
      CanExportData: Everyone
      Searchable: false
      RequireAppToken: true
      ShowPerformanceBar: false
      ShowPerformanceAnalyzer: false
      GlobalSearchExactMatch: false
      Utf8DataEncoding: false
      Timezone: Default
      Branding:
        AppHeader:
          HideQuickbaseStandardMenu: false
        AppFooter: {}
      RoleOrder:
        - !Ref
          Role: $Role_Viewer
        - !Ref
          Role: $Role_Participant
        - !Ref
          Role: $Role_Administrator
    Roles:
      $Role_Viewer:
        Type: QB::Application::Role
        Properties:
          Name: Viewer
          Description: 
          Default: false
          ManageUsers: false
          EditApp: false
          DisableAccess: false
          AppUI:
            HideSettings: false
            HideUsers: false
            HideFavorites: false
            HideSearch: false
            HideHelp: false
            HideTestAs: false
          TableUI:
            Global:
              HideInBar: false
              HideNewRecord: false
              HideGridEdit: false
              HideEmail: false
              HidePrint: false
              HideImportExport: false
              HideSaveSpreadsheet: false
              HideCreateCustomizeReport: false
              HidePersonalSettings: false
      $Role_Participant:
        Type: QB::Application::Role
        Properties:
          Name: Participant
          Description: 
          Default: true
          ManageUsers: true
          EditApp: false
          DisableAccess: false
          AppUI:
            HideSettings: false
            HideUsers: false
            HideFavorites: false
            HideSearch: false
            HideHelp: false
            HideTestAs: false
          TableUI:
            Global:
              HideInBar: false
              HideNewRecord: false
              HideGridEdit: false
              HideEmail: false
              HidePrint: false
              HideImportExport: false
              HideSaveSpreadsheet: false
              HideCreateCustomizeReport: false
              HidePersonalSettings: false
      $Role_Administrator:
        Type: QB::Application::Role
        Properties:
          Name: Administrator
          Description: 
          Default: false
          ManageUsers: true
          EditApp: true
          DisableAccess: false
          AppUI:
            HideSettings: false
            HideUsers: false
            HideFavorites: false
            HideSearch: false
            HideHelp: false
            HideTestAs: false
          TableUI:
            Global:
              HideInBar: false
              HideNewRecord: false
              HideGridEdit: false
              HideEmail: false
              HidePrint: false
              HideImportExport: false
              HideSaveSpreadsheet: false
              HideCreateCustomizeReport: false
              HidePersonalSettings: false

parameters.name: xQBLErrorsAsSuccess
parameters.description: If this header is set to true, the API will return a 207 status code even if there are errors. The errors will be returned in the response body.

400.description: Bad request. For example: Missing required headers, Missing required parameters, Malformed QBL and others. Message should provide more information, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

401/403.description: Insufficient access. This could be for many reasons such as: User doesn’t have SolutionHub access, User is not the owner or a contributor for the solution, User cannot create apps and others.  Message should provide more information.

4xx/5xx.description: Non-common error, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

parameters.name: xQBLErrorsAsSuccess
parameters.description: If this header is set to true, the API will return a 207 status code even if there are errors. The errors will be returned in the response body.

400.description: Bad request. For example: Missing required headers, Missing required parameters, Malformed QBL and others. Message should provide more information, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

401/403.description: Insufficient access. This could be for many reasons such as: User doesn’t have SolutionHub access, User is not the owner or a contributor for the solution, User cannot create apps and others.  Message should provide more information.

4xx/5xx.description: Non-common error, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

get.description:
Exports the solution and outputs the resulting QBL in a new record in the specified table. The QBL will be saved to a file in the file attachment field that is specified. The table cannot have any required fields besides the file attachment field.  
 We are releasing schema coverage for QBL in stages. See [what's supported today](https://helpv2.quickbase.com/hc/en-us/articles/30119680754068-QBL-version-0-4-overview) in our QBL documentation.

parameters.name: solutionId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the solution.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table.

parameters.name: fieldId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (fid) of the field. It needs to be a file attachment field.

parameters.name: xQBLErrorsAsSuccess
parameters.description: If this header is set to true, the API will return a 207 status code even if there are errors. The errors will be returned in the response body.

parameters.name: qBLVersion
parameters.description: The QBL version to be used for the export. If not specified the default would be used.

400.description: Bad request. For example: Missing required headers, Missing required parameters, Malformed QBL and others. Message should provide more information, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

404.description: A resource is missing. For example: The supplied solution or field does not exist.

401/403.description: Insufficient access. This could be for many reasons such as: User doesn’t have SolutionHub access, User is not the owner or a contributor for the solution, User cannot create apps and others.  Message should provide more information.

4xx/5xx.description: Non-common error, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

get.description:
Creates a solution using the QBL from the specified record.  
 We are releasing schema coverage for QBL in stages. See [what's supported today](https://helpv2.quickbase.com/hc/en-us/articles/30119680754068-QBL-version-0-4-overview) in our QBL documentation.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table.

parameters.name: fieldId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (fid) of the field. It needs to be a file attachment field.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the record.

parameters.name: xQBLErrorsAsSuccess
parameters.description: If this header is set to true, the API will return a 207 status code even if there are errors. The errors will be returned in the response body.

400.description: Bad request. For example: Missing required headers, Missing required parameters, Malformed QBL and others. Message should provide more information, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

404.description: A resource is missing. For example: The supplied solution, field or record does not exist.

401/403.description: Insufficient access. This could be for many reasons such as: User doesn’t have SolutionHub access, User is not the owner or a contributor for the solution, User cannot create apps and others.  Message should provide more information.

4xx/5xx.description: Non-common error, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

get.description:
Updates a solution using the QBL from the specified record.  
 We are releasing schema coverage for QBL in stages. See [what's supported today](https://helpv2.quickbase.com/hc/en-us/articles/30119680754068-QBL-version-0-4-overview) in our QBL documentation.

parameters.name: solutionId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the solution.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table.

parameters.name: fieldId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (fid) of the field. It needs to be a file attachment field.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the record.

parameters.name: xQBLErrorsAsSuccess
parameters.description: If this header is set to true, the API will return a 207 status code even if there are errors. The errors will be returned in the response body.

400.description: Bad request. For example: Missing required headers, Missing required parameters, Malformed QBL and others. Message should provide more information, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

404.description: A resource is missing. For example: The supplied solution, field or record does not exist.

401/403.description: Insufficient access. This could be for many reasons such as: User doesn’t have SolutionHub access, User is not the owner or a contributor for the solution, User cannot create apps and others.  Message should provide more information.

4xx/5xx.description: Non-common error, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

put.description:
Returns a list of changes that would occur if the provided QBL were to be applied. Learn more about [QBL syntax](https://help.quickbase.com/hc/en-us/articles/24845511223828-What-is-QBL).  
 We are releasing schema coverage for QBL in stages. See [what's supported today](https://helpv2.quickbase.com/hc/en-us/articles/30119680754068-QBL-version-0-4-overview) in our QBL documentation.

parameters.name: solutionId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the solution.

parameters.name: generated
parameters.description: The QBL to be used for the changeset.

parameters.name: xQBLErrorsAsSuccess
parameters.description: If this header is set to true, the API will return a 207 status code even if there are errors. The errors will be returned in the response body.

400.description: Bad request. For example: Missing required headers, Missing required parameters, Malformed QBL and others. Message should provide more information, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

404.description: Solution does not exist. The supplied solution ID was not found.

401/403.description: Insufficient access. This could be for many reasons such as: User doesn’t have SolutionHub access, User is not the owner or a contributor for the solution, User cannot create apps and others.  Message should provide more information.

4xx/5xx.description: Non-common error, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

get.description:
Returns a list of changes that would occur if the QBL from the provided record were to be applied.  
 We are releasing schema coverage for QBL in stages. See [what's supported today](https://helpv2.quickbase.com/hc/en-us/articles/30119680754068-QBL-version-0-4-overview) in our QBL documentation.

parameters.name: solutionId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the solution.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table.

parameters.name: fieldId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (fid) of the field. It needs to be a file attachment field.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the record.

parameters.name: xQBLErrorsAsSuccess
parameters.description: If this header is set to true, the API will return a 207 status code even if there are errors. The errors will be returned in the response body.

400.description: Bad request. For example: Missing required headers, Missing required parameters, Malformed QBL and others. Message should provide more information, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

404.description: A resource is missing. For example: The supplied solution, field or record does not exist.

401/403.description: Insufficient access. This could be for many reasons such as: User doesn’t have SolutionHub access, User is not the owner or a contributor for the solution, User cannot create apps and others.  Message should provide more information.

4xx/5xx.description: Non-common error, reach out to support if there’s lack of clarity.

get.description: Generates a document from a template. This feature is only available on business or enterprise plans.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: This is the ID of document template.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the table.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: The ID of the record

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: File name for the downloaded file

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: The content-type of the response. application/json will return a JSON payload with a base64 encoded file. application/octet-stream will download the file directly.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the file that is returned. Default is "pdf".

parameters.name: margin
parameters.description: Margin formatted as top right bottom left, separated by spaces. Add to override the value set in the template builder.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: Unit of measurement for the margin. Default is "in". Add to override the value set in the template builder.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Page size. Default is "A4". Add to override the value set in the template builder.

parameters.name: orientation
parameters.description: Page orientation. Default is "portrait". Add to override the value set in the template builder.

parameters.name: realm
parameters.description: Your Quickbase domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

name.description: The app name. Multiple apps with the same name are allowed in the same realm.

assignToken.description: Set to true to assign the app to the user token used to create it. Default is false.

description.description: The description for the app. Defaults to blank if omitted.

variables.description: App variables (max 10, optional). See About Application Variables.

id.description: The unique identifier for this application.

created.description: The time and date the app was created (ISO 8601, UTC).

updated.description: The time and date the app was last updated (ISO 8601, UTC).

dateFormat.description: The format used for displaying dates in the app (e.g., MM-DD-YYYY).

timeZone.description: The time zone used for displaying time values (e.g., (UTC-08:00) Pacific Time).

hasEveryoneOnTheInternet.description: Indicates if the app includes Everyone On The Internet access.

dataClassification.description: The Data Classification label assigned to the app (optional, may be 'None').

name.description: The name of the newly copied app.

description.description: The description of the newly copied app.

keepData.description: Whether to copy the app's data along with the schema.

excludeFiles.description: If keepData is true, whether to copy file attachments. Ignored if keepData is false.

usersAndRoles.description: If true, users will be copied along with their assigned roles. If false, users and roles will be copied but roles will not be assigned.

assignUserToken.description: Whether to add the user token used to make this request to the new app.

properties.description: The configuration properties for performing the app copy.

CopyAppRequest.description: Request body for copying an existing application.

id.description: The unique identifier for the copied application.

name.description: The app name. Multiple apps with the same name are allowed in the same realm.

created.description: The time and date the app was created (ISO 8601, UTC).

updated.description: The time and date the app was last updated (ISO 8601, UTC).

dateFormat.description: The format used for displaying dates in the app (e.g., MM-DD-YYYY).

timeZone.description: The time zone used for displaying time values (e.g., (UTC-08:00) Pacific Time).

hasEveryoneOnTheInternet.description: Indicates if the app includes Everyone On The Internet access.

ancestorId.description: The id of the app from which this app was copied.

dataClassification.description: The Data Classification label assigned to the app (optional, may be 'None').

CopyApp200Response.description: Response body for successful app copy operation.

name.description: The name of the application to delete, required for confirmation.

DeleteAppRequest.description: Request body for deleting an application, requiring the app name for confirmation.

deletedAppId.description: The ID of the deleted application.

DeleteApp200Response.description: Response body for successful deletion of an application.

id.description: The id of the field, unique to this table.

fieldType.description: The type of field, as described in the QuickBase Field Types documentation.

mode.description: For derived fields, this will be 'lookup', 'summary', or 'formula'. For non-derived fields, this will be blank.

noWrap.description: Indicates if the field is configured to not wrap when displayed in the product.

bold.description: Indicates if the field is configured to display in bold in the product.

required.description: Indicates if the field is marked required.

appearsByDefault.description: Indicates if the field is marked as a default in reports.

findEnabled.description: Indicates if the field is marked as searchable.

unique.description: Indicates if the field is marked unique.

doesDataCopy.description: Indicates if the field data will copy when a user copies the record.

fieldHelp.description: The configured help text shown to users within the product.

audited.description: Indicates if the field is being tracked as part of Quickbase Audit Logs.

properties.description: Additional properties for the field. See Field type details for more information.

Field.description: Represents the properties of an individual field in QuickBase.

foreignKey.description: Indicates if the field is a foreign key (or reference field) in a relationship.

numLines.description: The number of lines shown in Quickbase for this text field.

maxLength.description: The maximum number of characters allowed for entry in Quickbase for this field.

appendOnly.description: Whether this field is append only.

allowMentions.description: If someone can @mention users in the rich text field to generate an email notification.

sortAsGiven.description: Indicates if the listed entries sort as entered vs alphabetically.

carryChoices.description: Whether the field should carry its multiple choice fields when copied.

allowNewChoices.description: Indicates if users can add new choices to a selection list.

formula.description: The formula of the field as configured in Quickbase.

defaultValue.description: The default value configured for a field when a new record is added.

doesTotal.description: Whether this field totals in reports within the product.

autoSave.description: Whether the link field will auto save.

useI18NFormat.description: Whether phone numbers should be in E.164 standard international format.

maxVersions.description: The maximum number of versions configured for a file attachment.

linkText.description: The configured text value that replaces the URL that users see within the product.

parentFieldId.description: The id of the parent composite field, when applicable.

displayTimezone.description: Indicates whether to display the timezone within the product.

defaultToday.description: Indicates if the field value is defaulted today for new records.

openTargetIn.description: Indicates which target the URL should open in when a user clicks it within the product.

doesAverage.description: Whether this field averages in reports within the product.

decimalPlaces.description: The number of decimal places displayed in the product for this field.

defaultCountryCode.description: Controls the default country shown on international phone widgets on forms. Country code should be entered in the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

seeVersions.description: Indicates if the user can see other versions, aside from the most recent, of a file attachment within the product.

coverText.description: An alternate user friendly text that can be used to display a link in the browser.

currencySymbol.description: The current symbol used when displaying field values within the product.

targetFieldId.description: The id of the target field.

displayUser.description: The configured option for how users display within the product.

blankIsZero.description: Whether a blank value is treated the same as 0 in calculations within the product.

exact.description: Whether an exact match is required for a report link.

abbreviate.description: Don't show the URL protocol when showing the URL.

numberFormat.description: The format used for displaying numeric values in the product (decimal, separators, digit group).

appearsAs.description: The link text, if empty, the url will be used as link text.

width.description: The field's html input width in the product.

currencyFormat.description: The currency format used when displaying field values within the product.

displayDayOfWeek.description: Indicates whether to display the day of the week within the product.

commaStart.description: The number of digits before commas display in the product, when applicable.

choices.description: An array of entries that exist for a field that offers choices to the user.

targetTableId.description: The id of the target table.

displayRelative.description: Whether to display time as relative.

compositeFields.description: An array of the fields that make up a composite field (e.g., address).

displayCheckboxAsText.description: Indicates whether the checkbox values will be shown as text in reports.

displayTime.description: Indicates whether to display the time, in addition to the date.

versionMode.description: Version modes for files. Keep all versions vs keep last version.

snapFieldId.description: The id of the field that is used to snapshot values from, when applicable.

hours24.description: Indicates whether or not to display time in the 24-hour format within the product.

sortAlpha.description: Whether to sort alphabetically, default sort is by record ID.

hasExtension.description: Whether this field has a phone extension.

useNewWindow.description: Indicates if the URL should open a new window when a user clicks it within the product.

displayAsLink.description: Indicates if a field that is part of the relationship should be shown as a hyperlink to the parent record within the product.

lookupReferenceFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the reference in the relationship for this lookup.

summaryTargetFieldId.description: The id of the field that is used to aggregate values from the child, when applicable. Displays 0 if not required.

masterChoiceFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the reference in the relationship.

lookupTargetFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the target on the master table for this lookup.

masterChoiceTableId.description: The id of the table that is the master in this relationship.

summaryReferenceFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the reference in the relationship for this summary.

masterTableTag.description: The table alias for the master table in the relationship this field is part of.

comments.description: The comments entered on the field properties by an administrator.

sourceFieldId.description: The id of the source field.

FieldProperties.description: Additional properties specific to the field type.

permissionType.description: The permission given to the role for this field.

role.description: The role associated with a given permission for the field.

roleId.description: The Id of the given role.

FieldPermissionsInner.description: Defines a single permission entry for a field role.

fieldType.description: The type of field. See field type details for more info.

noWrap.description: Indicates if the field is configured to not wrap when displayed in the product. Defaults to false.

bold.description: Indicates if the field is configured to display in bold in the product. Defaults to false.

appearsByDefault.description: Indicates if the field is marked as a default in reports. Defaults to true.

findEnabled.description: Indicates if the field is marked as searchable. Defaults to true.

fieldHelp.description: The configured help text shown to users within the product.

addToForms.description: Whether the field should appear on forms. Defaults to false.

audited.description: Indicates if the field is being tracked as part of Quickbase Audit Logs. Defaults to false.

CreateFieldRequest.description: Request body for creating a new field in a table.

id.description: The id of the field, unique to this table.

mode.description: For derived fields, this will be 'lookup', 'summary', or 'formula'. For non-derived fields, this will be blank.

noWrap.description: Indicates if the field is configured to not wrap when displayed in the product.

bold.description: Indicates if the field is configured to display in bold in the product.

required.description: Indicates if the field is marked required.

appearsByDefault.description: Indicates if the field is marked as a default in reports.

findEnabled.description: Indicates if the field is marked as searchable.

unique.description: Indicates if the field is marked unique.

doesDataCopy.description: Indicates if the field data will copy when a user copies the record.

fieldHelp.description: The configured help text shown to users within the product.

audited.description: Indicates if the field is being tracked as part of Quickbase Audit Logs.

CreateField200Response.description: Response body for successful field creation.

fieldIds.description: List of field ids to be deleted.

DeleteFieldsRequest.description: Request body for deleting fields from a table.

deletedFieldIds.description: List of field ids that were deleted.

errors.description: List of errors found during the deletion process.

DeleteFields200Response.description: Response body for successful field deletion, with possible errors.

actions.description: The number of QuickBase actions where the given field is referenced.

appHomePages.description: The number of app home pages where the given field is referenced.

dashboards.description: The number of dashboards where the given field is referenced.

defaultReports.description: The number of default reports where the given field is referenced.

exactForms.description: The number of exact forms where the given field is referenced.

fields.description: The number of fields where the given field is referenced.

forms.description: The number of forms where the given field is referenced.

notifications.description: The number of notifications where the given field is referenced.

personalReports.description: The number of personal reports where the given field is referenced.

pipelines.description: The number of pipelines where the given field is referenced.

relationships.description: The number of relationships where the given field is referenced.

reminders.description: The number of reminders where the given field is referenced.

reports.description: The number of reports where the given field is referenced.

roles.description: The number of roles where the given field is referenced.

tableImports.description: The number of table imports where the given field is referenced.

tableRules.description: The number of table rules where the given field is referenced.

webhooks.description: The number of webhooks where the given field is referenced.

FieldUsage.description: Represents usage statistics for a field in a table.

count.description: The number of times a field has been used for the given item.

UsageCount.description: A count of usage for a specific category.

_dummy.description: Unused dummy property to force model generation.

additionalProperties.description: The value object for a field ID key.

Record.description: A record with field ID keys (e.g., '6') and value objects (e.g., { value: 'data' }).

mergeFieldId.description: The field ID to merge on (optional).

fieldsToReturn.description: Field IDs to return in the response (optional).

data.description: Array of upserted records with field IDs and values.
Array of successfully upserted records (may be empty).

from.description: The table identifier (dbid) from which to delete records.

where.description: A QuickBase query string specifying which records to delete.

DeleteRecordsRequest.description: Request body for deleting records from a table using a query.

numberDeleted.description: The number of records successfully deleted.

DeleteRecords200Response.description: Response body for successful deletion of records.

top.description: Max number of records to return

compareWithAppLocalTime.description: Compare times with app local time

data.description: Array of record data with field IDs as keys

numRelationships.description: The number of relationships in the current response object.

metadata.description: Additional information about the results that may be helpful.

GetRelationships200Response.description: Response containing relationships for a table.

id.description: The relationship id (foreign key field id).

parentTableId.description: The parent table id of the relationship.

childTableId.description: The child table id of the relationship.

isCrossApp.description: Whether this is a cross-app relationship.

RelationshipField.description: A field involved in a relationship (foreign key, lookup, or summary).

id.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table.

alias.description: The automatically-created table alias for the table.

description.description: The description of the table, as configured by an application administrator.

created.description: The time and date when the table was created, in ISO 8601 format (UTC).

updated.description: The time and date when the table schema or data was last updated, in ISO 8601 format (UTC).

nextRecordId.description: The incremental Record ID that will be used when the next record is created.

nextFieldId.description: The incremental Field ID that will be used when the next field is created.

defaultSortFieldId.description: The id of the field that is configured for default sorting.

defaultSortOrder.description: The default sort order for the table, either ascending (ASC) or descending (DESC).

keyFieldId.description: The id of the field that is configured to be the key on this table, usually the Quickbase Record ID.

singleRecordName.description: The builder-configured singular noun of the table.

pluralRecordName.description: The builder-configured plural noun of the table.

sizeLimit.description: The size limit for the table (e.g., '150 MB').

spaceUsed.description: The amount of space currently being used by the table (e.g., '17 MB').

spaceRemaining.description: The amount of space remaining for use by the table (e.g., '133 MB').

name.description: The new name for the table.

singleRecordName.description: The new singular noun for records in the table. Defaults to 'Record' if not provided.

pluralRecordName.description: The new plural noun for records in the table. Defaults to 'Records' if not provided.

description.description: The new description for the table. Defaults to blank if not provided.

UpdateTableRequest.description: Request body for updating table properties. At least one property must be provided.

name.description: The name of the event. This property is not returned for automations.

url.description: The URL to the automation, accessible from the browser. Only returned for automations.

isActive.description: Indication of whether the current event is active.

owner.description: The user that owns the event.

tableId.description: The unique identifier of the table to which the event belongs.

AppEvent.description: An event associated with an application in QuickBase.

userName.description: User name as updated in user properties. Optional, appears if not the same as user email.

EventOwner.description: The owner of an event in QuickBase.
